page.title: 18ATTITUDES
page.content: ATTITUDES Most of the people interviewed in this area were happy with their lives in the country.They had anxieties and most of these were about traffic .The noise of fast cars disturbs the rural tranquillity and, more seriously, fast traffic in country lanes can be a danger to life and limb.Speed limits should be set and enforced.Although most admit that the Motorway has brought the advantage of increased accessibility, the loss of farm land and the general increase in local traffic is not welcomed. Walking is a popular activity and many get much pleasure from long country walks in peaceful surroundings.
